trans-unit.source: Operations provided by the Batch service REST API may have multiple versions for backwards compatibility as the API evolves over time.
trans-unit.target: Operations provided by the Batch service REST API may have multiple versions for backwards compatibility as the API evolves over time.

trans-unit.source: You must specify which version of an operation you wish to use when it is called by providing the version with your REST call.
trans-unit.target: You must specify which version of an operation you wish to use when it is called by providing the version with your REST call.

trans-unit.source: If your application calls an older version of an operation, you can choose to continue calling the older version, or modify your code to call a newer version.
trans-unit.target: If your application calls an older version of an operation, you can choose to continue calling the older version, or modify your code to call a newer version.

trans-unit.source: If the version is not specified or an incorrect version is specified then an error will be returned.
trans-unit.target: If the version is not specified or an incorrect version is specified then an error will be returned.

trans-unit.source: To specify which version of an operation to use, specify the <legacyItalic>api-version</legacyItalic> query parameter.
trans-unit.target: To specify which version of an operation to use, specify the <legacyItalic>api-version</legacyItalic> query parameter.

trans-unit.source: The version is of the format Group.Major.Minor where Group is in the format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ and Major is an integer and Minor is an integer.
trans-unit.target: The version is of the format Group.Major.Minor where Group is in the format ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ and Major is an integer and Minor is an integer.

trans-unit.source: The version of the Batch API described here is "2015-06-01.2.0".
trans-unit.target: The version of the Batch API described here is "2015-06-01.2.0".
